document.additionalDateTooltip: An additional date that can be added to the document as metadata. This additional date is optional. If 'Receipt date' is selected, the document status can only be set to 'definitive' or 'archived'.

OpenNotificatie.title: Open Notificaties
OpenNotificatie.description: Open Notificaties is a modern and open source component for routing messages between components, systems and applications.

Taak.description: Save tasks in the Objects API with Open Notificaties.

ObjectsApi.title: Objects API
ObjectsApi.description: The Objects API aims to easily store various objects and make them available in standardized format.

Besluiten.title: Besluiten API
Besluiten.description: API for storage and disclosure of decisions and associated metadata.

ProductAanvragen.title: Productaanvragen API
ProductAanvragen.description: API for registration and disclosure of products.

HaalCentraalBrp.title: Haal Centraal BRP
HaalCentraalBrp.description: APIs with which your municipality can request basic data directly from the national registrations.

ContactMoment.title: Contactmomenten API
ContactMoment.description: API for storage and disclosure of contact moments and associated metadata.

OpenZaak.title: OpenZaak
OpenZaak.description: OpenZaak is a production-worthy API platform that implements the API standard for case-oriented working (the ZGW APIs).

searchFields.noneConfigured: No search fields have been configured for this document type.

searchFieldsTooltips.datetimeRange: A date and time range field

searchFieldsOverview.title: Title
searchFieldsOverview.deleteSearchFieldConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this search field?

searchFieldsOverviewTooltips.title: The title is an optional field that appears as a label for the current search field. When the title is not set, the default value will be the search field key translation (if there is no translation available, the original key value will be displayed).
searchFieldsOverviewTooltips.key: A unique key by which the search field is identified. If the key is not unique, you will not be able to save the search field.
searchFieldsOverviewTooltips.path: A path which leads to the property you want to search on. For searching in the document's JSON schema, follow this example: 'doc:customer.firstName'. For searching in the document properties, follow these examples: 'case:createdBy', or 'case:sequence', or 'case:assigneeFullName'. Note: When there are special characters in a property, the property must be enclosed in quotes. For example: case:"loan-accepted".
searchFieldsOverviewTooltips.objectsApiPath: A path which leads to the property you want to search on. For searching in the objects API JSON, follow this example: 'object:/customer/firstName'.
searchFieldsOverviewTooltips.dataType: The data type decides what input is shown to the user. For example, for the data type 'Date', a date picker is shown.
searchFieldsOverviewTooltips.fieldType: The field type decides the values the user can input. For the option 'Single', the user can only input a single value. For the option 'Range', the user may input two values, and these values, and all the values in between, are searched for.
searchFieldsOverviewTooltips.matchType: The match type decides how values in the database are matched to the search values. For the match type 'Exact', the value '1' would only be matched to the value '1'. For the match type 'Contains', the value '1' would be matched to the value '1', '123', and all other values containing '1'.
searchFieldsOverviewTooltips.dropdownDataProvider: The dropdown data source determines where the data for the dropdown comes from.
searchFieldsOverviewTooltips.configFile: Use a config file with dropdown values. The config value must be present on the server
searchFieldsOverviewTooltips.dropdownListValues: Set custom values for the dropdown list. The value shown in the dropdown list should be entered in the right text-field. The left text-field should contain the id of that value.

listColumn.title: Title
listColumn.titleTooltip: If this field is filled in, this title will display as the column header, overriding any available translations.
listColumn.keyTooltip: A unique key by which the column is identified. If the key is not unique, you will not be able to save the column.
listColumn.pathTooltip: A path which leads to the property you want to show. For the document's JSON schema, follow this example: 'doc:customer.firstName'. For document properties, follow these examples: 'case:createdBy', or 'case:sequence', or 'case:assigneeFullName'. Note: When there are special characters in a property, the property must be enclosed in quotes. For example: case:"loan-accepted".
listColumn.objectsApiPathTooltip: A path which leads to the property you want to search on. For searching in the objects API JSON, follow this example: 'object:/customer/firstName'.
listColumn.displayTypeTooltip: This option decides how the data is eventually displayed in the table.
listColumn.defaultSortTooltip: If this field has a value, the table will be sorted by default on this property, in the direction specified. Only one column at a time can have this property. On creating a new column, if another column already has a default sort specified, this input field will be disabled.
listColumn.hasEnvConfigWarningTitle: Case type already has a column configuration
listColumn.hasEnvConfigWarning: This case type already has a column configuration available in the environment configuration of the application. In order to enable configuring the columns for this case type through the user interface, remove this environment configuration.
listColumn.noConfigWarning: There are no columns configured for this dossier type. Click the button above to add a column.
listColumn.dateFormatTooltip: A date format supported by Moment.js (https://momentjs.com/docs/).
listColumn.uniqueKeyWarning: The key for this column must be unique.
listColumn.enumTooltip: The keys and values used to transform display data in the table.
listColumn.enumTooltipOptional: The values used to transform display data in the table.
listColumn.deleteColumnConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this column?

tooltips.objecttypeVersion: The version of the object type
tooltips.formDefinitionView: The name of the form IO definition that will be used to display the object.
tooltips.formDefinitionEdit: The name of the form IO definition that will be used to edit the object.
tooltips.showInDataMenu: Indicates whether the object type is visible in the menu
